summary: Email correspondence between a U.S. Attorney's Office attorney and an FBI Special Agent regarding FOIA litigation and an inquiry about whether any passports for Jeffrey Epstein were seized beyond the one from his safe. The FBI agent confirms only one passport was in evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses FOIA litigation regarding passports seized from him, with confirmation that only one passport was taken from his safe.

events.title: Passport seizure inquiry
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office attorney emails an FBI Special Agent to inquire whether any passports for Jeffrey Epstein were seized aside from the one from his safe, due to FOIA litigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI confirmed only one passport for Jeffrey Epstein was seized as evidence, taken from his safe.
The inquiry was prompted by FOIA litigation and a request for information about Epstein's passports.
The correspondence occurred in January 2022, indicating ongoing legal matters related to Epstein years after his death.
